comment_0: This song is nothing but comfort for me. I chose âHere Comes the Sunâ by The Beatles, and my take on it is that itâs a moment of realization from a person finally knowing that theyâre âhappyâ.

The line âhere comes the sunâ is repeated constantly. The use of âsunâ giving off a bright and joyful feeling, and I believe that and the fact that itâs repeated 10 times throughout the entire song is used to emphasize the idea that better times are coming. 

In the first verse of the song, The Beatles reference winter time even though the majority of the song focuses on the sun. I believe that they did it to symbolize the more melancholic times. That can be seen as they say âlong cold lonely winterâ, for the use of âlonelyâ and âcoldâ give off a sadder mood than the rest of the song. 

However, in the second verse they say that winter âseems like years since itâs been hereâ, and I say that is done in order to metaphorically say that the subject of the song went from a depressing and more âwinteryâ time to a happier âsummerâ time. 

Lastly, the subject of the song constantly references a âlittle darlingâ, and those two words turned the entire song into a conversation form one to another, as if it could be a father and a daughter or maybe a couple. It makes the song a lot more encouraging because it shows that as heâs telling the other person that thing can and are getting better, heâs realizing that himself.

I believe that in its entirety, the message of the song is that better times are coming no matter how âcoldâ life is getting.
